shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 2r-162va) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 2r-126r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 127v-140r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 141v-148r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 148v-158rb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 158va-162va) II) Register of feasts of the 12 Apostles (fols. 147bv-dr)
Additiones 1-11.

owners.owner: Priest Gäbrä Maryam and his wife Wälättä Maryam are mentioned as the owners in Additio 4. Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ is mentioned as the owner in Additio 3 and together with Gäbrä Kidan, Wäldä Śǝllase, Wälättä Maryam, Täklä Giyorgis, Wälättä Muse, Wälättä Giyorgis in a prayer in Additio 5.

dcomments.dcomment: 17th cent. If the note in Additio 2 concerns King Minas (ʾAdmas Sägäd) and if it was written in his time, then the dating should be changed to the second half of the 16th cent.

txstates.txstate: Holes on fols. 13, 14, 15, 31, 66. The majority of fols. are worn out and stained with wax. The leather cover of the spine is torn off and partly missing at the back side of the Ms. A tear carefully amended at the bottom of fol. 150.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather. Overback made of tooled leather of somewhat different colour which is torn off and partly missing at the back board. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 5 tools are used: single line fillet, single circle, corni-form, x-form, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. A parchment guard has been inserted in the centrefold of quire XX.

bnstatedetails.bnstatedetail: The overback made of tooled leather is torn off and partly missing at the back board.

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 1) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – XIV(8/fols. 106r-113v) – XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XVI(8/fols. 122r-129v) – XVII(8/fols. 130r-137v) – XVIII(8/fols. 138r-145v) – {XIX(4+4/leaves 3-6 in fols. 147a-d; leaves 1-2, 7-8 in fols. 146r-147v, 148r-150v)} – XX(10/fols. 151r-159v) – B(5; s.l.: 5, stub before 1/fols. 160r-164v).
Two bifolios (leaves 3-6) of smaller size (with Text II) were later inserted into the middle of quire XIX, between leaves 1-2 and 7-8.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1), I-2), I-3). All data for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4), I-5). All data for fol. 149r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: For fols. 2r-162v Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: Texts I-1), I-2), I-3): 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C; Texts I-4), I-5):1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Text II in fols. 147bv-dr is written in a recent, poorly-trained hand.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; numbers and titles of the psalms; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and titles of Texts I-2); the title and numbers of Text I-3); doxology at the end of the parts of Text I-3); five lines of the incipit of Text I-4) alternating with 2 black lines; first two lines of the daily readings of Text I-4); some words and selected 3-4 lines of Text I-4); introductory prayer of Text I-5); three lines of Text I-5) in fol. 158vb; some words of Text I-5); elements of punctuation signs. The names of the donors in fol. 148rb are rubricated in crimson.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The traditional titles of the Psalms are missing. The titles present in the Ms. correspond to those in the Hebrew Bible. The titles of many Pss. are preceded by the word ፍጻሜ („completion“, „end“), perhaps referring to the ending of the previous psalm.

additional.cont: Fol. 1r-v: Mälkǝʾa Gäbrä Krǝstos “Image of Gäbrä Krǝstos”, incomplete.
additional.det: The text corresponds to the second part of Mälkǝʾa Gäbrä Krǝstos (pp. 40-42 from the words ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ሰላማዊ፡ መናኔ) which is included in the edition Gädlä Gäbrä Krǝstos (in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic), Addis Abäba 1958 A.M. Written crudely in black ink.

additional.cont: Fol. 1v (the bottom margin): Historiographic note.
additional.add: Fol. 1v (the bottom margin): አመ፡ ይጸብኡ፡ ምስለ፡ ሐፄ፡ አድማስ፡ ወተዝካሮ…
additional.det: Half of the note is effaced. Perhaps the note refers to the struggle between king Minas (ʾAdmas Sägäd) and his nephew Täzkarä Dǝngǝl (Täzkaro) in 1560/61. At the end, there is number ፶ወ፯.

additional.cont: Fol. 2r: Ownership note.
additional.add: Fol. 2r: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ዓቢይ፡ እግዚእ፡ ትኩኖ፡ መርሖ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወለብእሲቱ
additional.tran: Fol. 2r: This is the book of Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ; may it be the guide to the Heavenly Kingdom, for him and for his wife.

additional.cont: Fol. 148r: Ownership note.
additional.add: Fol. 148r: ዝዳዊት፡ ዘቄስ፡ ገበረ፡ ማርያም፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም
additional.tran: Fol. 148r: This is a Psalter of priest Gäbrä Maryam and his wife Wälättä Maryam.
additional.det: The note is crudely written crudely in black ink, the word ማርያም is rubricated.

additional.cont: Fol. 148r: Supplication prayer to Mary for the donor and his family.
additional.det: At the end of the prayer the baptismal names of the donor and members of his family are mentioned: Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ, Gäbrä Kidan, Wäldä Śǝllase, Wälättä Maryam, Täklä Giyorgis, Wälättä Muse, Wälättä Giyorgis. Written in black ink; the majority of the baptismal names are rubricated.

additional.cont: Fol. 158rb: Ownership note.
additional.det: The note contains the baptismal names of the owner and members of his family: Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ, Wäldä Śǝllase, Gäbrä Maryam, Gäbrä Kidan.

additional.cont: Fol. 162vb (above): ʾAsmat-prayer.
Fol. 162vb (below): Magic recipe.
additional.det: Written in black ink, in Amharic.

additional.cont: Fol. 163r: The Vita of St. Roch (Roqo) followed by an ʾasmat-prayer.
additional.det: The Vita of St. Roch (commemorated on 26 Miyazya) is identical to the one included in the edited Synaxarion (Mäṣḥafä Sǝnkǝssar. Kä-mäggabit ǝskä ṗagʷǝmen, Addis Abäba 1993 EC). Saint Roch was given a covenant from Christ that those asking for his intercession will be spared from "pest" (ḥǝmamä bǝdbǝd). Сp. V. PLATONOV, Efiopskie rukopisi v sobranijah Sankt Peterburga, St. Petersburg 1996, 21, no. 13 - Ef. 41 (a Synaxarion notice for 23 Miyazya, St. Roqo/Roch); GrébGriaule II, 74, Éthiopien 259 - Griale 55. The Vita is followed by an ʾasmat-prayer for an individual called Wäldä Śǝllase. The supplicant asks for saving him from barya, fera, nǝdad (l. 11) and waba (l. 20). Written in ink by a trained hand. The last six lines of the text are blurred but they are readable. In the upper margin, there are two captions, the one on the left being effaced.

additional.cont: Fols. 163v-164r: Hymn to St. George.
additional.det: Written in angular script by a trained hand. The last 3 lines of the text in fol. 163v and the last 6 lines in fol. 164r are effaced.

additional.cont: Fol. 147r: Supplication note.
additional.det: In the note, which follows the register of the feasts of the 12 Apostles, qes Bärḥe entreats for commemorating him. It is written in Amharic, in a poor hand.

extras.extra: - Title of the Ms., ዳዊት, is written on the cover, on the face of the inner side of the front board and in fol. 1r, at the bottom. - Corrections written over erased passages of text, in the main hand: fols. 18r, 39r, 100v. - Corrections written over erased passages of text, in a secondary hand: fols. 35v, 76r, 127r, 159va. - Crude drawings: fols. 1r, 148r, 161v, 162r. - Writing exercises in fidäl: fols. 4r, 17v, 18v, 19r, 57v, 58r, 66r, 69v, 70r, 97v, 160v, 161r. - The name Nǝwayä Maryam is mentioned at the end of some psalms: fols. 16r, 23v, 34r, 41v, 77v, 83v. - Writing exercises in pencil and pen: fols. 113v, 123r, 129v, 147ar-br, 147dv, 148r, 148v, 157v, 162v, 164v. - Writing exercises in purple pen: fol. 140. - Pen trials: fols. 153v, 154r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Texts I-1) – I-3) are divided into daily readings. The names of the weeksdays were later crudely written, in a secondary hand, in the upper margin of fols: Fol. 1v: ዘሠኑይ Fol. 23v: ዘሰሉስ Fol. 47v: ዘረቡዕ Fol. 68v: ዘሐሙስ Fol. 97r: ዘአርብ Fol. 113r: ዘቅዳሜ Fol. 126v: ዘእሑድ.
